Class BackgroundTask

  • Object
    • FutureTask<V>
      • Task<Integer>
        • BackgroundTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, Future<Integer>, RunnableFuture<Integer>, Worker<Integer>, EventTarget

    public class BackgroundTask
extends Task<Integer>
    This class controls the background task execution - which is run on a separate thread to the GUI. It extends JavaFX 'Task' and overrides 'call()' and 'cancel()'.
    Author:
    carolinesmith

    • Method Detail

      • call

        protected Integer call()
        This method overrides Javafx.concurrent.Task#call() method. It calls 'process_Commmand()' from Command.java to start shell command execution, and catches IOExceptions and Interrupted Exceptions.
        Specified by:
        call in class Task<Integer>
        See Also:
        Task.call()

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
        This methods override javafx.concurrent.Task#cancel() method. It prints out the cancelled message to assist in debugging.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Future<Integer>
        Overrides:
        cancel in class Task<Integer>

      • updateProgress

        protected void updateProgress(double workDone)
